The Righteous Scar

A single-player, souls-like, third-person action-adventure game that immerses you in an ancient world on the brink of destruction. When evil forces rise from the underworld, the world is thrown into chaos. Three powerful races, each with their own disagreements, must set aside their differences and join forces to defeat the demonic hordes threatening to take over the world.

You are the first to encounter the evil forces as their portal opens for the first time. It’s up to you to fight back. Embark on a journey filled with dread, as you fight through terrifying monster.

Choose Your Race and Class

At the heart of The Righteous Scar lies the choice of one of three unique races, each with their own strengths, weaknesses, and abilities:

  • Valkorians – Battle-hardened warriors with high strength and resilience, perfect for players who prefer powerful melee combat.

  • Sylphs – Agile and swift, Sylphs wield wind magic and excel at evasion, ideal for players who enjoy high-speed action and spellcasting.

  • Brutaliths – Immense and unyielding, Brutaliths can absorb heavy damage, providing a strong tank role that keeps enemies at bay while others strike.

Character Progression & Customization

Try to reach and defeat guardian of lift that teleports you to overworld.

Combat, Magic, and Exploration

The game offers melee weapon combat system with magic spells and variety of enemies.

content_descriptors.notes: This game includes elements not suitable for all audiences. You’ll encounter some nudity and veiled nudity, along with characters using alcohol, tobacco, and unapproved medical substances. The world is bleak, dark, and unsettling—though not realistic, it’s designed to evoke fear. There’s crude language and occasional swearing woven into the dialogue, fitting the harsh realities of the setting. Violence plays a central role, with depictions of blood, bodily injuries, and violent acts, including accidental deaths and criminal activity. Corpses and the consequences of violence are part of the narrative, and detailed descriptions of these acts may be present.

short_description: When blades fall silent, and blood tells its tale, a scar remains—a mark not of rage, but of absolution. In The Righteous Scar, violence becomes virtue, and what’s buried beneath the skin reveals a truth only the damned can see.
